RID Eastern Ave. Elevator Out

The Eastern Elevator at Joliet Station is out of service. Customers can use the elevator at New Lenox
as alternate boarding stations. Updates will be provided

UPN #817Mechcanical Problems
Union Pacific North train #817, scheduled to arrive Waukegan at 4:51 PM, is on the move and operating 15 to 20 minutes behind schedule due mechanical problems.

Union Pacific Northwest train #715, scheduled to arrive Crystal Lake at 4:35 PM is on the move and operating 45 to 50 minutes behind schedule due to track construction.

MDW Elevator Out Of Service
The Grand/Cicero North elevator is out of service. Customers can use Western avenue or Hanson Park as alternate boarding stations. Updates will be provided.

UPNW Inbound and Outbound Delays

Union Pacific Northwest inbound and outbound trains may be operating up to 45 minutes behind schedule due to ongoing track construction. Please listen to announcements for delay times and location of your train.
metrarail.com/riding-metra/service-updates?Source=0&Website=1&OnBoard=0&Email=1&Twitter=1
Metra Alert ME - Homewood East Side Construction Will Begin March 13

Beginning Monday, March 13, access to the Homewood Station from the east will be closed for station construction until Summer 2024.  Access to the boarding platform will be through the Park Avenue entrance ONLY (west side of tracks).

 

Beginning, Monday, March 6, the Pace bus stop will relocate from Harwood Avenue to Park Avenue.  Please allow additional time and use caution near the work zone.

Metra Alert BNSF - Attention Berwyn Commuters: Starting July 5, 2023, Stanley Avenue will be under construction for approximately 14 weeks.
Attention Berwyn Commuters: Starting July 5, 2023, Stanley Avenue will be under construction for approximately 14 weeks. Please use caution through the work zone and allow extra travel time.
metrarail.com/riding-metra/service-updates?Source=0&Website=1&OnBoard=0&Email=1&Twitter=0
Metra Alert ME - 79th street/Chatham Station Closure Beginning July 10 - Station Rebuild Project

The 79th street/Chatham station on the Metra Electric line will be closed beginning Monday, July 10 for approximately 7 months. During this time passengers can use 75th and 83rd street stations as alternatives. This is part of the Metra Electric Community initiative to transform multiple stations on the Metra Electric District. Once completed, stations will have enclosed ADA-accessible street-level entrances, lobbies with elevators, new stairs, headhouses, new composite deck platforms, new lighting, and signage.  For more information click here.
metrarail.com/riding-metra/service-updates?Source=0&Website=1&OnBoard=0&Email=1&Twitter=1
Metra Alert UP-NW - Metra is making temporary changes to the midday schedule of the UP Northwest Line from July 11 through July 18

Metra is making temporary changes to the midday schedule of the UP Northwest Line from Tuesday, July 11, through Tuesday, July 18, due to an ongoing tie replacement project between Barrington and Crystal Lake. The following trains will be affected: Inbound trains 648 and 654 and outbound trains 621 and 627 will be cancelled.  Train 644 will depart Crystal Lake at 9:40 a.m., which is 20 minutes later than its regular schedule. Train 633, which departs Chicago at 3:22 p.m., will terminate at Barrington, and Train 635, which departs Chicago at 3:35 p.m., will make stops at Barrington and Pingree Road to accommodate passengers and Train 656 will originate in Crystal Lake instead of Harvard.  A copy of the complete July 11-18 schedule for the UP Northwest Line can be found at https://metra.com/alternate-schedules.

Metra Alert UP-N - Track construction Saturday, July 15 through Sunday, July 16

Track construction will begin Saturday, July 15 through midday Sunday, July 16. Trains may incur delays enroute up to 15 minutes behind schedule passing through the work zone. Please listen to announcements for any platform changes. For additional information visit metra.com/constructionnotices.
metrarail.com/riding-metra/service-updates?Source=0&Website=1&OnBoard=0&Email=1&Twitter=0
Metra Alert UP-NW - Track construction Saturday, July 15 through Sunday, July 16

Track construction will begin Saturday, July 15 through Sunday, July 16. Trains may incur delays enroute up to 20 minutes behind schedule passing through the work zone. Please listen to announcements for any platform changes. For additional information visit metra.com/constructionnotices.
